data.title: London Free Press
data.meta_description: David Robbins passed away. This is the full obituary where you can express condolences and share memories. Published in the London Free Press on 2021-08-17.
data.text:
ROBBINS, David Barry

Of St. Thomas, passed away peacefully, on Monday, August 16, 2021, at the St. Thomas-Elgin General Hospital, at the age of 80. Dearly loved husband of over 61 years of Betty (Beecroft) Robbins and loved father of Allan Robbins (Kathy) and Garry Robbins (Janice). Cherished grandfather of Justin (Taylor), Temma-Lynne (Tom), Kayly and Adam and great- grandfather of Lawson Seguin. Dear brother of Robert and Sharon. Predeceased by siblings Bill, Yvonne and John. Dear brother- in-law of Evelyn and Brian Forsyth, Harold and June Beecroft, Alex and Margaret Beecroft, Wayne and Cathy Beecroft, the late Bill and Edna Beecroft and the late Eileen Player. Sadly missed by a number of nieces and nephews. David was born in London, Ontario on September 7, 1940, the son of the late Horace and Hilda (Stock) Robbins. He was retired from General Motors, Diesel Division, Canada. David was a member of the Salvation Army. Resting at Williams Funeral Home, 45 Elgin St., St. Thomas where funeral service will be held Thursday at 11:00 a.m. Interment to follow in Cowal Cemetery. Visitation on Wednesday from 2-5 p.m. Remembrances may be made to the Canadian Cancer Society or to Diabetes Canada.

Published online August 17, 2021

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
